sub_title: Fresh Graduate I Master Degree of Global Marketing
summary:
I am a motivated and dedicated professional with a passion for marketing. Originally from Malaysia, I completed my bachelor's degree at Chihlee University of Technology in Taiwan. I am pursuing a Master's Degree in Global Marketing as a second-year student at Feng Chia University.

Driven by a curiosity to explore the differences between European and Asian marketing, I decided to embark on an international exchange program after my thesis defense. Currently, in the second semester of my master's program, I am serving as an exchange student at Hanze University of Applied Sciences in the Netherlands, focusing on international marketing.

This exchange experience has allowed me to immerse myself in a new cultural and business environment, broadening my perspectives and enhancing my understanding of global marketing dynamics. It has been an incredible opportunity to compare and contrast marketing practices, and market trends between Europe and Asia.

During my academic journey, I have focused on developing expertise in various areas of marketing, including marketing strategy, e-commerce, business analytics, digital marketing, online to offline, Martech, content marketing and copywriting. One of my particular strengths is copywriting, and throughout my studies, I have been responsible for crafting compelling copy for assignments and competitions. Additionally, I have also been involved in generating ideas and creating scripts for advertisements and video content. One area where I excel is in copywriting, which is a valuable skill in today's content marketing landscape. 

In my master's program, I further expanded my knowledge by delving into the field of consumer behaviour analysis. This involved studying research methodologies, and data analysis techniques to gain insights into consumer motivations, preferences, and decision-making processes.

With my passion for storytelling, my understanding of consumer behaviour, and my all the marketing knowledge have learned, I am excited to contribute to the marketing field

projects.title: Expanding The DJ Company to Denmark Strategic Proposal
projects.description:
I worked on a project team tasked with developing a strategic proposal to expand The DJ Company from the Netherlands into Denmark as part of a group project during my exchange program in the Netherlands.

As part of this project, I was responsible for the following:
1. Identifying target cities in Denmark for The DJ Company's initial market entry, based on factors like population demographics, local music scene, and major festivals/events. I selected cities that would provide the right customer base and opportunities for The DJ Company in its early stages in the market.
2. Defining the target demographic and analyzing their online behaviors to determine the ideal target audience for marketing efforts. I outlined the key characteristics (age, income, interests, etc.) that make this group an attractive target, as well as where and how they engage online in order to tailor personal marketing.
3. Mapping the customer journey stages and touchpoints to consider for digital marketing campaigns. I looked at the customer path from initial awareness to loyalty and advocacy and identified key actions and touchpoints at each stage (awareness, interest, consideration, conversion, loyalty, advocacy). 
4. Providing recommendations for improving The DJ Company's Instagram presence based on current best practices.
5. Creating Instagram and website mockups using tools like Wix to demonstrate proposed improvements.

In the project i learned,
1. Gain hands-on experience in visually bringing marketing strategies to life. I learned how to quickly ideate and iterate on different layouts and content presentation to engage audiences.
2.The importance of mapping the customer journey to create targeted digital marketing campaigns
3. My exchange experience provided valuable insights into European marketing strategies and best practices.

projects.title: Master's degree Research/ Thesis: Multi-Channel Attribution Model in Customer Journey with Markov Chain Analysis
projects.description:
This study investigates how marketers can accurately assign credit for conversions to multiple touchpoints and channels that facilitate customer journeys. 
The objective is to utilize attribution modelling, specifically by utilizing Markov Chain analysis, to uncover similarities and differences in conversion paths among three different industries.
The study gathers data from 17 companies that are classified into three main industries. 
The purpose is threefold: first, to identify similarities and differences in the results of the Markov Chain model across channels; 
Second, to determine which channels appear most frequently in customer journeys; 
Third, to identify channels with a high probability of conversion. Traditional heuristic models are used for comparison purposes.
This research utilizes Markov Chain modeling to provide detailed insights into the influence of channels in conversion paths.

projects.title: Line Sticker
projects.description: For this assignment, the professor wanted us to imagine collaborating with a brand and design Line stickers and a marketing strategy. I chose the salad and light meal brand "The Greenery," which I worked part-time during university. The Greenery was inspired by the founder's study abroad experience in Australia. After returning to Taiwan, the founder brought those ideals back. Through a similar story and brand ethos, I designed stickers representing the brand. Each sticker features one of The Greenery's dishes. The stickers depict a family, representing the brand's broad consumer demographic. I was very happy to collaborate with an art student friend on this project - I sketched the concepts and he created the final versions.

projects.description:

My primary role in the project was Exhibition Reception Team Leader.

Responsibilities:
1. Drafting reception scripts for welcoming judges and participants to the exhibition.
2. Anticipating questions from judges and preparing appropriate responses (Q&A).
3. Creating a work plan for the day of the competition.
4. Content design for the kiosk machines at the exhibition booth

Additionally, I was involved in the production of a promotional video for the city.

Responsibilities:
1. Conceptualized and wrote the script for the promotional video.
2. Conducted location scouting and filmed introduction footage.
3. Interviewed the General Manager of Kaohsiung Jiahong Yacht Company.

In the project, I learned:

1. Improved Video Scriptwriting Skills: Enhance my skills in crafting impactful video scripts. This experience allowed me to develop a stronger grasp of creating compelling narratives and engaging content.
2. Enhanced Communication Confidence: Being part of the reception team, I had the opportunity to interact with strangers, which was a challenge for me initially. However, through this project, I became more confident in speaking to unfamiliar individuals and expressing myself with enthusiasm while introducing our content during the competition.
3. Increased Independence and Resourcefulness: As part of the team responsible for creating the promotional video, I had to become more self-reliant. This involved taking the initiative in generating creative ideas for the video, conducting location scouting, filming introduction footage, and arranging an interview with the General Manager of Kaohsiung Jiahong Yacht Company. This experience helped me develop a sense of autonomy and resourcefulness in executing tasks effectively.

projects.title: Fundraising Campaign
projects.description:
This was a fundraising campaign in collaboration with the Chinese Long-Term Care Association to support an elderly meals program. Our goal was to raise NT$300,000 on the crowdfunding platform Dodoker within one month, which we successfully achieved.

In this project, my responsibilities included:
1. Gratitude Gifts for Fundraising Campaign: I was responsible for designing and implementing a system of appreciation gifts for our campaign backers to express our gratitude for their contributions.
2. Platform Fundraising Campaign Content Design: led the development of the campaign content on the Dodger platform, ensuring it effectively communicated our mission, the impact of the Solo Elderly Companionship Program, and the importance of contributing to our cause.

What i learned in this project:
1. Effective Crowdfunding Strategy: I gained hands-on experience in planning and executing a successful crowdfunding campaign. This involved understanding the nuances of crowdfunding, such as setting realistic funding goals, creating compelling campaign content, and leveraging various communication channels to reach potential backers.
2.Social Impact Awareness: Through this project, I deepened my understanding of the social impact that can be achieved through fundraising and community support. I learned how even a relatively modest fundraising goal, when effectively communicated and executed, can have a meaningful impact on the lives of those in need.

"Fundraising Campaign" project not only allowed me to contribute to a meaningful cause but also provided me with a practical understanding of strategic fundraising, enhanced communication abilities, and insights into fostering community engagement.

projects.title: Online to Offline Marketing
projects.description:
Project Description: This project was a journey from a course to a competition at the end of the semester. In the first semester, we started learning about e-commerce operations, including topics such as keyword advertising, etc, In the second semester, we collaborated with a company, and our team was responsible for promoting Bluetooth speakers. In this project, my responsibilities were:

1. Product Photoshoot: I was in charge of capturing promotional images for the product.
2. Live Streaming: I conducted live marketing sessions with my teammates on the company's Facebook fan page to promote the product.
3. Facebook Posts: I learned how to manage a fan page and write engaging and informative posts. Each team member contributed one post per week. One of the posts I wrote in December 2018, titled "2019 Horoscope for December," received significant engagement with 2,648 fan comments and a reach of over 50,000 people.

In this project, I gained valuable insights and skills related to social media marketing and targeted advertising. Specifically, I learned:

1. Effective Utilization of Social Media Marketing: Through the project, I learned how to strategically leverage social media platforms to promote products and engage with the audience. This involved understanding the preferences and behaviors of the target audience. 
2.Targeted Advertising: I became proficient in the art of targeted advertising, which involved identifying the specific characteristics and preferences of the target audience and creating advertisements that resonate with them. This included utilizing keyword advertising and other techniques to maximize the reach and impact of our campaigns.
